qas.question: What group performed the song "Hot Number"?
In what year did the Bee Gees relocate to Miami?

answers.text: Gloria Estefan and the Miami Sound Machine

qas.question: What music label showcased KC and the Sunshine Band?
In what decade was disco popular?
What group hated the song "Hot Number"?
In what year didn't the Bee Gees relocate to Miami?

plausible_answers.text: Gloria Estefan and the Miami Sound Machine

qas.question: What music label snubbed KC and the Sunshine Band?
In what decade was disco unpopular?

context: In the early <a4_0>1970s<a4_0/>, the Miami disco sound came to life with <a3_0><b8_0>TK Records<a3_0/>,<b8_0/> featuring the music of KC and the Sunshine Band, with such hits as "Get Down Tonight", "(Shake, Shake, Shake) Shake Your Booty" and "That's the Way (I Like It)"; and the Latin-American disco group, <a0_0><b5_0>Foxy<b5_0/><a0_0/> (band), with their hit singles "Get Off" and "Hot Number". Miami-area natives George McCrae and Teri DeSario were also popular music artists during the <b9_0>1970s<b9_0/> disco era. The Bee Gees moved to Miami in <a1_0><b6_0>1975<b6_0/><a1_0/> and have lived here ever since then. Miami-influenced, <a2_0><b7_0>Gloria Estefan and the Miami Sound Machine<b7_0/><a2_0/>, hit the popular music scene with their Cuban-oriented sound and had hits in the 1980s with "Conga" and "Bad Boys".
